body:
This meta-issue tracks the actions required to have full wallet load/create/unload at runtime.

- [ ] Add locking to the global `vpwallets` to ensure no concurrency races when adding to the vector. This is sufficient thread safety for `loadwallet` and `createwallet`, but not `unloadwallet` (#13017 and #13028).
- [ ] Add `loadwallet` RPC. Initially, this won't update the available wallets in the GUI (#10740)
- [ ] Hook up the `loadwallet` RPC to `CClientUIInterface::LoadWallet()` so newly loaded wallets are available in the GUI (no PR yet)
- [ ] Add "load wallet" dialog in bitcoin-qt so wallets can be loaded in the GUI (no PR yet)
- [ ] Add `createwallet` RPC. Initially, this won't update the available wallets in the GUI (#13058)
- [ ] Hook up the `createwallet` RPC to `CClientUIInterface::LoadWallet()` so newly created wallets are available in the GUI (no PR yet)
- [ ] Add "create wallet" dialog in bitcoin-qt so wallets can be created in the GUI (no PR yet)
- [ ] Update `vpwallets` to be shared pointers (or similar) so that wallets can be freed safely (no PR yet).
- [ ] Add `unloadwallet` RPC. Initially, this won't update the available wallets in the GUI (no PR yet)
- [ ] Hook up the `unloadwallet` RPC to a new `CClientUIInterface::UnloadWallet()` function so unloaded wallets are removed from the GUI (no PR yet)
- [ ] Add an "unload wallet" command in bitcoin-qt so wallets can be unloaded in the GUI (no PR yet)

I expect we should be able to do everything for load/create wallets in time for V0.17. unloadwallet may take a bit longer due to the extra difficulties around concurrency.
title: Dynamic wallet load / create / unload
